SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.jaunt.component
Class Form

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt.component.Form

public class Form
extends Object

A class representing a HTML/XHTML form, with methods for setting input fields (eg textfields, dropdown menus, checkboxes, hidden fields, etc), as well as methods for submitting the form and for generating list of HTTP requests representing different permutations of form input.

Since:
0.9.0
Author:
Tom Cervenka

          The form element that begins the form.

          Un-tags all elements tagged for permutation.

          Returns the form Element for this Form.
 short getEnctype()
          Retrieves the enctype of the form, or the default enctype if no enctype is specified in the form
 short getMethod()
          Retrieves the method of the current form, denoted by the method constants in HttpRequest, or if no method was specified in the form, returns the default HttpRequest.GET
 HttpRequest getRequest()
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission without pressing any particular submit button, or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
 HttpRequest getRequest(Pattern submitLabelPattern)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the first submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression Pattern (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
 HttpRequest getRequest(String submitButtonRegex)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the first submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
 List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations()
          Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.
 List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations(String submitLabelRegex)
          Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.
 boolean isEditable()
          Returns whether the form has at least one editable (visible and non-disabled) input component.
 Form set(String name, String value)
          Sets the form input with the specified name to the specified value; FileComponents are set to upload the file who's location is specified by the specified value; Checkboxes are 'checked' if the specified value is the same (case insensitive) as the value attribute of the checkbox (or if the specified value is "on" in cases where the checkbox has no value attribute).
 void setAction(String action)
          Sets the action attribute of the form to the specified url.
 Form setCheckBox(String name, boolean checked)
          Sets whether the first checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive) name is checked and throws an Exception if the checkbox was not found.
 void setEnctype(short enctype)
          Sets the enctype of the form to the specified enctype (constant of HttpRequest).
 Form setFile(String name, File file)
          Sets the first FileComponent with the specified (case insensitive) name to upload the specified File and throws an Exception if no FileComponent with specified name was found.
 Form setHidden(String name, String value)
          Sets the first hidden field with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name exists.
 void setMethod(short method)
          Sets the method (GET or POST) to the specified method constant in HttpRequest.
 Form setPassword(String name, String value)
          Sets the first password field with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name exists.
 Form setRadio(String name, int n)
          Sets the radiobutton at index n and with the specified name to be 'checked' and deselects all onther radiobuttons with the same name, throwing an exception if no such radiobutton exists.
 Form setRadio(String name, String value)
          Sets the radiobutton with the specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'checked' and deselects all other radiobuttons with the same name.
 Form setSelect(String name, int n)
          Sets the nth menu option with the specified (case insensitive) name to 'selected', and deselects all other options in the same select tag, throwing an Exception if no such menu option was found.
 Form setSelect(String name, String value)
          Sets the first menu option with specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'selected' and deselects all other options in the same select tag if the select tag does not have 'multiple' keyword; throws an Exception if no such menu option exists.
 Form setTextArea(String name, String value)
          Sets the textarea with specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no such button exists.
 Form setTextField(String name, String value)
          Sets the first textfield with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name was found.
 Document submit()
          Submits the the form without pressing any particular submit button; no name-value pair contribution from any submit button is added to the query string.
 Document submit(int submitButtonIndex)
          Submits the the form by pressing the submit button specified by its index, with indexing starting at 0, and throws an Exception if specified submitButton is not found.
 Document submit(String valueRx)
          Submits the the form by pressing the first submit button who's value (ie, text label) matches (case-insensitive) the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches) and throws an Exception if the specified submitButton does not exist.
 Form unchoose(short labelPosition, String label)
          Unselects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive) label.

getElement

public Element getElement()
Returns the form Element for this Form.

setMethod

public void setMethod(short method)
Sets the method (GET or POST) to the specified method constant in HttpRequest.

Parameters:
method - the request method (eg, HttpRequest.TYPE_GET, HttpRequest.TYPE_POST)

getMethod

public short getMethod()
Retrieves the method of the current form, denoted by the method constants in HttpRequest, or if no method was specified in the form, returns the default HttpRequest.GET

Returns:
either HttpRequest.TYPE_GET or HttpRequest.TYPE_POST.

setAction

public void setAction(String action)
Sets the action attribute of the form to the specified url.

Parameters:
action - a fully qualified url.

getAction

public String getAction()
Retrieves the action attribute of the form.

Returns:
the action attribute value or if no action attribute exists, returns url of the document (sans querystring), or null if the document was not retrieved via url.

setEnctype

public void setEnctype(short enctype)
Sets the enctype of the form to the specified enctype (constant of HttpRequest).

getEnctype

public short getEnctype()
Retrieves the enctype of the form, or the default enctype if no enctype is specified in the form

Returns:
an enctype (constant of HttpRequest).

isEditable

public boolean isEditable()
Returns whether the form has at least one editable (visible and non-disabled) input component.

apply

public Form apply(Object... params)
           throws JauntException
Applies the specified parameters in succession to the form's editable (ie, visible and non-disabled) inputs, starting from the input after the most recently edited input (or starting from the first input, if the form has not yet been edited).

Parameters:
params - a string param will populate a textfield/textarea/passwordField (unless the string is "\t", in which case it will skip to the next form component); a boolean param will set/unset a checkbox, an integer param will select the nth radio button in a radiobutton group OR select the nth option in a menu (starting at index 0); a regular expression (string that is enclosed in round brackets) will select the matching menu option(s) in a menu; a File will set the vale of a file-upload component; any other type of param will be treated as a string by calling its toString() method.
Throws:
JauntException

set

public Form set(String name,
                String value)
         throws NotFound
Sets the form input with the specified name to the specified value; FileComponents are set to upload the file who's location is specified by the specified value; Checkboxes are 'checked' if the specified value is the same (case insensitive) as the value attribute of the checkbox (or if the specified value is "on" in cases where the checkbox has no value attribute). In order to uncheck a checked checkbox, the value parameter should be null.

Throws:
NotFound

setFile

public Form setFile(String name,
                    File file)
             throws NotFound
Sets the first FileComponent with the specified (case insensitive) name to upload the specified File and throws an Exception if no FileComponent with specified name was found.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setTextField

public Form setTextField(String name,
                         String value)
                  throws NotFound
Sets the first textfield with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name was found.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

public Form setRadio(String name,
                     String value)
              throws NotFound

setRadio

public Form setRadio(String name,
                     int n)
              throws NotFound
Sets the radiobutton at index n and with the specified name to be 'checked' and deselects all onther radiobuttons with the same name, throwing an exception if no such radiobutton exists.

Parameters:
name - the case insensitive name.
n - index of the radiobutton, with indexing starting at 0.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setTextArea

public Form setTextArea(String name,
                        String value)
                 throws NotFound
Sets the textarea with specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no such button exists.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setSelect

public Form setSelect(String name,
                      String value)
               throws NotFound
Sets the first menu option with specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'selected' and deselects all other options in the same select tag if the select tag does not have 'multiple' keyword; throws an Exception if no such menu option exists.

Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

setSelect

public Form setSelect(String name,
                      int n)
               throws NotFound
Sets the nth menu option with the specified (case insensitive) name to 'selected', and deselects all other options in the same select tag, throwing an Exception if no such menu option was found.

Parameters:
name - the (case insensitive) name,
n - index of the menu option, with indexing starting at 0.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound

choose

public Form choose(String menuLabel,
                   String menuItemRegex)
            throws NotFound,
                   MultipleFound
Completes the menu that has the specified text label (case insensitive, wordspace insensitive) by selecting the menuitem(s) that matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches).

Parameters:
menuLabel - case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive, left-side label.
menuItemRegex - case-insensitive regular expresion to match the text of one or more menuItems.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

                    String text)
             throws NotFound,
                    MultipleFound
Fills the textfield, password field, or textarea field that has the specified text label (case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive) with the specified value.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

choose

public Form choose(short labelPosition,
                   String label)
            throws NotFound,
                   MultipleFound
Selects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive) text label.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelPosition - position constant of class Label indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

public Form unchoose(short labelPosition,
                     String label)
              throws NotFound,
                     MultipleFound
Unselects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive) label.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, wordspace-insensitive label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelPosition - position constant of class Label indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Returns:
a reference to the parent Form.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

submit

public Document submit()
                throws ResponseException
Submits the the form without pressing any particular submit button; no name-value pair contribution from any submit button is added to the query string.

Returns:
Document or null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
Throws:
ResponseException

submit

public Document submit(int submitButtonIndex)
                throws NotFound,
                       ResponseException
Submits the the form by pressing the submit button specified by its index, with indexing starting at 0, and throws an Exception if specified submitButton is not found.

Returns:
Document or null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
Throws:
NotFound
ResponseException

submit

public Document submit(String valueRx)
                throws SearchException,
                       ResponseException
Submits the the form by pressing the first submit button who's value (ie, text label) matches (case-insensitive) the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches) and throws an Exception if the specified submitButton does not exist.

Returns:
Document or null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.
Throws:
SearchException
ResponseException

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest()
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission without pressing any particular submit button, or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest(String submitButtonRegex)
                       throws NotFound,
                              MultipleFound
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the first submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.

Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest(Pattern submitLabelPattern)
                       throws NotFound,
                              MultipleFound
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the first submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression Pattern (using Matcher.matches), or returns null if this form has no (implicit or explicit) action.

Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

addPermutationTarget

public void addPermutationTarget(String name)
Tags the form component with the specified name (ie the value of its name attribute) as a permutation target.

See Also:
getRequestPermutations(), getRequestPermutations(String)

addPermutationTarget

public void addPermutationTarget(String name,
                                 Object[] values)
Tags the form component with the specified name (ie the value of its name attribute) as a permutation target.

Parameters:
values - an array of values through which the tagged component should be varied to generate the request variations (this parameter should be null if the values are already contained within the component).
See Also:
getRequestPermutations(), getRequestPermutations(String)

clearPermutationTargets

public void clearPermutationTargets()
Un-tags all elements tagged for permutation.

getRequestPermutations

public List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations()
Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

See Also:
addPermutationTarget(String, Object[])

getRequestPermutations

public List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations(String submitLabelRegex)
                                         throws NotFound,
                                                MultipleFound
Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

Parameters:
submitLabelRegex - regular expression used for (case insensitive) matching the label of the submit button (using Matcher.matches) to contribute name-value pairs to each permutation.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound
See Also:
addPermutationTarget(String, Object[])
